bibl.title: Junichi Yamamoto v. Luther Weedin. Decision
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JUNICHI YAMAMOTO FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
Judson Falkner, Assistant District Attorney, attorney for U. S. Gates & Hellsell, Attorneys for petitioner.

The petitioner, a Japanese, shipped from Japan as a seaman for a round trip voyage, and deserted at Seattle on or about the 17th of September, 1917. He had no passport from the Japanese government, and entered the United States in violation of Rule 11 of the Immigration Rules. He has resided in Seattle from the date of his entry, and his de- portation is directed. He seeks release on the ground that his presence is governed by Sec. 34 of the Immigration Act of February 5, 1917, which limits deportation to three years from date of unlawful entry.

The petitioner belongs to " skilled or unskilled" labor, having no passport, and having made an un- lawful entry is subject to deportation at any time within five years from the date of his entry under the 6th Provise of Sec. 3 of the Immigration Act of 1917. This issue has been adjudi- cated against the petitioner by the Circuit Court of Appeals in Ono vs. UNS., 267 U.S. 359. The writ is denied.
